citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The IACUC’s unaffiliated member is the spouse of the Attending Veterinarian. The unaffiliated member must be
unaffiliated in order to represent the general community interests in the proper care and use of animals. Correct by June
5th, 2023 by having the Institutional Official appoint an individual to serve on the IACUC as an unaffiliated member; this
person must not be affiliated with the institution in any way other than as a member of the IACUC, and must not be a
member of the immediate family of a person who is affiliated with the institution.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The IACUC failed to approve SOPs that govern animal care and use at the facility. There are currently 7 cats and 8 dogs
that are being held at the facility but are not on an active research protocol. The care of these animals is described in the
“Cat/Dog Research SOP” but this SOP has not been approved by the IACUC. IACUC review and approval of proposed
animal activities is important for ensuring oversight of animal care and use at the facility and compliance with the Animal
Welfare Act. Correct by June 5th, 2023 by ensuring that the IACUC reviews and approves all animal care and use
activities before animals are used.

The facility’s Program of Veterinary Care for Dogs is not signed by the Attending Veterinarian (AV). Instead, it is signed by
the Institutional Official who also acts as a clinical veterinarian on site. The signature of the AV is important for ensuring
that contents of the plan are accurate and approved by the AV. Correct by June 5th, 2023 by obtaining the AV’s signature
on the written Program of Veterinary Care for Dogs.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the IACUC chair.
n

narrative:
2.31(b)(3)(ii) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The IACUC’s unaffiliated member is the spouse of the Attending Veterinarian. The unaffiliated member must be 
unaffiliated in order to represent the general community interests in the proper care and use of animals. Correct by June 
5th, 2023 by having the Institutional Official appoint an individual to serve on the IACUC as an unaffiliated member; this 
person must not be affiliated with the institution in any way other than as a member of the IACUC, and must not be a 
member of the immediate family of a person who is affiliated with the institution. 
2.31(c)(6) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The IACUC failed to approve SOPs that govern animal care and use at the facility. There are currently 7 cats and 8 dogs 
that are being held at the facility but are not on an active research protocol. The care of these animals is described in the 
“Cat/Dog Research SOP” but this SOP has not been approved by the IACUC. IACUC review and approval of proposed 
animal activities is important for ensuring oversight of animal care and use at the facility and compliance with the Animal 
Welfare Act. Correct by June 5th, 2023 by ensuring that the IACUC reviews and approves all animal care and use 
activities before animals are used. 
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs.

The facility’s Program of Veterinary Care for Dogs is not signed by the Attending Veterinarian (AV). Instead, it is signed by 
the Institutional Official who also acts as a clinical veterinarian on site. The signature of the AV is important for ensuring 
that contents of the plan are accurate and approved by the AV. Correct by June 5th, 2023 by obtaining the AV’s signature 
on the written Program of Veterinary Care for Dogs. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the IACUC chair.
